topic.title: Cluster Overview
topic.shortdesc: Cluster Overview is the home page that provides an overview of your cluster health, including RAM and disk usage and activity.

body.p: Cluster Overview provides information about the cluster, buckets, and servers.

section.title: Cluster
section.p: The Ram Overview section provides information on the RAM and disk usage information for your cluster:

dlentry.dd: The total amount of memory configured in the cluster.
The amount of RAM allocated to data buckets within your cluster.
The amount of RAM not allocated to data buckets within your cluster.
The amount of memory in use across all buckets (data actively being stored).
The unused amount of memory that is available for storing data.

body.p: The Disk Overview section provides similar summary information for disk storage space across your cluster.

dlentry.dd: The total amount of disk storage available across your entire cluster for storing data.
The amount of usable space for storing information on disk. The figure shows the amount of space available on the configured path after non-Couchbase files have been taken into account.
The quantity of disk space used by data other than Couchbase information.
The amount of disk space being used to store information on disk actively.
The free space available for storing objects on disk.

section.title: Buckets
section.p: The Buckets section provides two graphs:.

dlentry.dd: Provides information on the level of activity in the cluster in terms of storing or retrieving objects from the data store.
Indicates how frequently Couchbase has to go to the disk to retrieve the information instead of using the information stored in RAM.

section.title: Servers
section.p: The Servers section indicates overall server information for the cluster:

dlentry.dd: The number of active servers within the current cluster configuration.
The number of servers that have failed over due to an issue that should be investigated.
Shows the number of servers that are down and that cannot be contacted.
Shows the number of servers that are currently waiting to be rebalanced after joining a cluster or being reactivated after failover.
